#Text=Unbrick the HTC One X
#Text=When your HTC One X becomes bricked , you may experience force-close errors , freezing issues , and problems with powering your device off and on .

#Text=If you ’ve managed to brick your HTC One X , you can unbrick your device by either performing a hard reset , or by reversing the effects of any new updates that caused your device to brick in the first place .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Performing a Hard Reset
#Text=Verify that your HTC One X is fully charged .
#Text=A full charge will help ensure that your device will not power down at any point during the reset process and cause further complications .
#Text=Back up all personal data , if possible .
#Text=A hard reset will wipe and erase all data from the memory of your device .
#Text=Sync your personal information with Google ’s servers , or connect your HTC One X to your computer using a USB cable so you can transfer personal data to your computer .
#Text=Tap on “ Settings , ” then tap on “ Power . ”
#Text=If you are unable to access the menu on your device due to software problems associated with bricking , skip ahead to step #5 .
#Text=Remove the checkmark next to “ Fast Boot . ”
#Text=Power off your device .
#Text=Press and hold the Volume Down key , then press and hold the Power button .
#Text=Continue pressing both keys until the device powers on .
#Text=Release the Power button .
#Text=The Bootloader options menu will display on-screen .
#Text=Use the volume keys to navigate to and highlight “ Factory Reset . ”
#Text=Press the Power button to make your selection .
#Text=Your HTC One X will reset , restore the original factory settings , and will be un-bricked .
#Text=Reversing New Updates
#Text=Power off your device .
#Text=Press and hold the Volume Down key , then press and hold the Power button .
#Text=Continue pressing both keys until the device powers on .
#Text=Release the Power button .
#Text=The Bootloader options menu will display on-screen .
#Text=Use the volume keys to navigate to and highlight “ Recovery Mode . ”
#Text=Press the Power button to make your selection .
#Text=Your HTC One X will boot into recovery mode .
#Text=Use the volume keys to highlight “ wipe data factory reset , ” then press the Power button .
#Text=Navigate to and highlight “ wipe cache partition , ” then press the Power button .
#Text=Press the back button , then select “ advanced . ”
#Text=Scroll to and select “ wipe dalvick cache . ”
#Text=Press the back button until you return to the recovery mode menu .
#Text=Scroll to and select “ reboot system now . ”
#Text=Your HTC One X will reboot , and any recent updates you applied to your device will now be removed .
#Text=Tips
#Text=If your HTC One X became bricked after applying new updates , follow the steps outlined in method two prior to performing a hard reset as outlined in method one .
#Text=In some cases , reversing new updates can unbrick your device .
#Text=Attempt to unbrick your device before taking your HTC One X to a repair shop or contacting the manufacturer for repairs .
#Text=If your device became bricked as a result of rooting , your warranty will be voided with the manufacturer , and you may have to pay out of pocket for repairs .
